results.title: Dishwashing by hand
results.creator_credit: Dale W. Imus, Donald F. Grant and Los Angeles City Health Department
results.brief_description: A film which emphasises the importance of hygienic dish-washing, showing that for health and attractive presentation in either large or small cafeterias, dishes must be scraped, pre-rinsed, washed, rinsed and drained. Both mechanical and hand methods are illustrated.

results.title: A Discussion of Herman Melville's 'Bartleby'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
The student is given an opportunity to develop his own independent critical analysis of the book and then to compare his ideas with those of the critic Charles Van Doren who has considered the work in depth. Explores the many possibilities for creative interpretation.

results.title: A Discussion of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's 'The Crocodile'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
Commentator Clifton Fadiman discusses various themes and ideas presented in the short story “The Crocodile” by Dostoyevsky, and he points out the significance of the themes in relation to the life of the author and certain events in Russian history.

results.title: Discussion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Intending to stimulate language development and curiosity, and enlargement of concepts, understanding, the teacher introduces some human vertebrae and discusses their relation to the human form, allowing the children to handle the bones. For preschool eduction.

results.title: Understanding different points of view
results.creator_credit: Richard Murison, Barbara Dunning, Meredith D. Gall and Far West Laboratory for Educational Research and Development
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Discussing Controversial Issues”
Explains that to provide good discussion and to understand other points of view the participants should: give reasons, ask for reasons and ask for clarification; while the Moderator should: ask for reasons, state areas of agreement and disagreement and ask for temporary agreement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Murison, Barbara Dunning, Meredith D. Gall and Far West Laboratory for Educational Research and Development

results.title: Discovery: Puri Puri
results.brief_description: An examination of the physiological consequences of the impact of Western civilisation on the peoples of Papua New Guinea. The program reveals the subtle and insidious ways in which the Western way of life has irrevocably disturbed the human ecology of Papua New Guinea, and suggests that, in order to achieve social and economic viability as a competitive nation, Papua New Guinea must achieve a state of biological fitness. Narrated by Robert Bruning.
